climbs.name: Try It Out
climbs.fa: Scott M, Sam F, the Swamp Donkeys

content.description: I’m looking for hardcore guys that mean it and want to do it. Try it out!
content.protection: Single rack .3-3 Camalots, nuts, Titons optional
content.location: This route is on the west face of the rock formation about 50 yards north of John Rae / Genre Dome. Look for the vertical crack that bends right near its top just right of an interesting rock erosion. There are no bolts on this route and a gear anchor is easily built on top. Walk off.

climbs.name: Third Shift
climbs.fa: Brent Bingham, Joe Garcia, Manny Rangel

content.description: The meat of the first pitch is near the beginning. Wide crack protected in back and climbed easily on the outside.
content.protection: single rack to #5 camalot, nuts, slings, one bolt on pitch 2.
content.location: The line is on the west face. Easy to spot.

content.description: Conceivably try this one on a very cold morning with fingers taped and new shoe rubber...   and lots of chalk?Mount thin face by stepping off large boulder and climb past two bolts. From second flexy clip, transition face into right-angling seam that slightly widens to fingers and then eventually peters out. At the dwindle, ascend thin face between crack systems and then do a balancy traverse right into the large prominent groove on the southwest face of the dome. It's easy climbing to the end of the dihedral. There's two more bolts angling left on the final upper face. A good pro belay at the top of the groove is possible if one decides to split the climb into two pitches.
content.protection: Single set of cams. Six bolts; four on route and two for belay at top. Single line rap from Third Shift's anchor on north side.
content.location: Starts to the right of Third Shift on JRD's west face.

content.description: Above the roof the crack thins to tips and it eases up at the finish. Stem your way below the roof for an easy start.
content.protection: double rack 00 C3 to .75, single #2; chains
content.location: This is the thin crack left of Third Shift on Genre Dome. Approach is via south Boulder Loop Trail. Park at end of Phoenix Rd (in SE Payson) in cul de sac. Squat concrete structure hides trail head. Take trail for @ 75 yds to second right. Go left at any junctions and walk about 20 minutes to base of dome; route on west side.

climbs.name: Profect Dilemma
climbs.fa: Mike Knarzer, Manny Rangel, Ryan Myers

content.description: Midway you will find a dilemma, pro or hold, you decide. Of course, there is smaller pro instead.
content.location: This is on the SW face of the third buttress east of main dome. Start in the bottom between 2nd and 3rd buttress.

content.description: The first ten feet can be avoided by standing on the flake or you can make it much harder. The start is overhung and the crux. The top half is fairly easy.
content.protection: cams to #3 for bottom and wide stuff above (big bros if you need pro)
content.location: Just right of the giant overhang forming the south face of Genre Dome.

climbs.name: Finger of Fate
climbs.fa: Manny Rangel, Ryan Myers, Marilyn Geninati

content.description: The start is best to the left of first bolt then up near the end is the thinnest section. Good rock and thin edges with plenty of bolts.
content.location: South face of dome is very very overhung. Up and right/easterly is a blank slab right of a long crack system.

content.description: It's a low angle hand crack, perfect for practice. Gets to the top of the Profect Dilemma anchors (great descent too).
content.protection: Soloed on FA but it will eat hand sized pro.
content.location: Walk to the right to the bottom of the second buttress from the main dome.

content.description: We stemmed the start and then it was a leaning wide (#4-5 camalot) crack from wide hands to hand stacks. Face holds made it easier. It awaits a clean ascent  on lead.
content.location: Right of the main south face of Genre Dome is a line of smaller domes. This line is on east-facing wall inside a huge fissure. Approach route carefully, the fall to the base could be a long one.

content.description: This is the face right of Finger of Fate. The hardest part of the route isn't the crux, it's clipping the second bolt off thin holds. I recommend a stick clip but Brent just fired it. Thin edges force the climber to find the right path.
content.protection: seven bolts and shared anchor with C Shift crack.
content.location: Second buttress right of main dome.

content.description: This lonely dome complex has a striking dihedral on the west side (seen as you approach). Overhung on the south side for futuristic projects. On the east side of the south face are some other big cracks.
